title: ID for 1924 Saddlery Catalogue Cover Font
content:
Can anyone help me identify the red "Schoellkopf Company" font? Or perhaps that style of fonts? Any help is much appreciated...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018213102im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Schoellkopf%20Company%20Logo#1_5003.jpg)

[http://www.cabincreekcds.com/images/Schoellkopf25/Schoellkopf25\_Pg1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018213102/http:/www.cabincreekcds.com/images/Schoellkopf25/Schoellkopf25_Pg1.jpg "http://www.cabincreekcds.com/images/Schoellkopf25/Schoellkopf25\_Pg1.jpg")
author: MarkLingo

comments.content:
Probably hand lettering. Also, I don't recall a font circa 1924 that looked like this. But there were posters by lettering artist Ludwig Holwein from about 1922 that used diamond shapes for the bar locations. His work was the basis for [Bremen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018213102/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bremen/) designed by Richard Lipton in 1992.  
Don
